meta.content: Everything you need to know to prepare for, and protect yourself from Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)
meta.name: description

div.a: Click here for view more about it. VIEW MORE

div.span: This is an official website of the

li.a: Healthcare Providers and Local Health Districts

div.span: This is just a separator between the navigation and the help and search icons

form.label: Search in Ohio Agriculture Department portal

div.class: component-container wpthemeLeft wpthemePrimaryContainer wpthemeCol ibmDndColumn id-Z7_N9GA11K0N02N80Q11JQA6L4IK6
div.name: ibmMainContainer

a.onclick: if (typeof wptheme != 'undefined') wptheme.contextMenu.init({ 'node': this, menuId: 'skinAction', jsonQuery: {'navID':ibmCfg.portalConfig.currentPageOID,'windowID':wptheme.getWindowIDFromSkin(this)}, params: {'alignment':'right'}});
a.onmousemove: javascript:if (typeof i$ != 'undefined' && typeof wptheme != 'undefined') { i$.removeClass(this,'wpthemeActionDisabled'); this.onmousemove = null; }
a.onkeydown: javascript:if (typeof i$ != 'undefined' && typeof wptheme != 'undefined') {if (event.keyCode ==13 || event.keyCode ==32 || event.keyCode==38 || event.keyCode ==40) {wptheme.contextMenu.init(this, 'skinAction', {'navID':ibmCfg.portalConfig.currentPageOID,'windowID':wptheme.getWindowIDFromSkin(this)}); return false;}}

li.a: Healthcare Providers and Local Health Districts

a.onclick: if (typeof wptheme != 'undefined') wptheme.contextMenu.init({ 'node': this, menuId: 'skinAction', jsonQuery: {'navID':ibmCfg.portalConfig.currentPageOID,'windowID':wptheme.getWindowIDFromSkin(this)}, params: {'alignment':'right'}});
a.onmousemove: javascript:if (typeof i$ != 'undefined' && typeof wptheme != 'undefined') { i$.removeClass(this,'wpthemeActionDisabled'); this.onmousemove = null; }
a.onkeydown: javascript:if (typeof i$ != 'undefined' && typeof wptheme != 'undefined') {if (event.keyCode ==13 || event.keyCode ==32 || event.keyCode==38 || event.keyCode ==40) {wptheme.contextMenu.init(this, 'skinAction', {'navID':ibmCfg.portalConfig.currentPageOID,'windowID':wptheme.getWindowIDFromSkin(this)}); return false;}}

div.p: Responsible RestartOhio is about protecting the health of employees, customers, and their families; supporting community efforts to control the spread of the virus; and, leading in responsibly getting Ohio back to work.

a.span: about the article: Responsible Restart Ohio

div.h2: Economic Resources for Individuals and Families
div.p: Ohioans are facing new financial challenges as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, and state agencies have a number of programs and policies in place to help them weather the storm.

a.span: about the article: Economic Resources for Individuals and Families

div.p: The COVID-19 pandemic can be overwhelming for parents and concerning to children. Ohio Department of Health Director Amy Acton, MD, MPH, recommends that parents and others who work with young people strive to help them feel understood, empowered, and hopeful. She offers the below guidelines.

a.span: about the article: Talking To Kids - COVID-19 Checklist

div.p: We are all in this together, Ohio. If you are interested in helping your fellow Ohioans, please email together@governor.ohio.gov with your name, contact information, and how you are interested in helping.
Separating the myths from the facts about coronavirus disease 2019.

a.span: about the article: COVID-19: Myths Versus Facts

div.div: Ohio Department of Health call center is ready to answer your questions about COVID-19
The Call Center is staffed from 9 a.m to 8 p.m each day, including weekends.
Last Updated: 04/28/20 (Updated daily at 2 p.m.) *<1% sex not reported

a.aria-label: Actualización del COVID-19: Recubrimientos faciales, Grupos consultivos sobre Restaurantes, Barberías y Salones

a.h3: Actualización del COVID-19: Recubrimientos faciales, Grupos consultivos sobre Restaurantes, Barberías y Salones

section.p: (COLUMBUS, Ohio)— El Gobernador de Ohio Mike DeWine, el Vicegobernador Jon Husted y la Dra. Amy Acton, MD, MPH, brindaron hoy las siguientes actualizaciones sobre la respuesta de Ohio a la pandemia de COVID-19.

a.aria-label: COVID-19 Update: Face Coverings, Advisory Groups on Restaurants, Barbershops, and Salons

a.h3: COVID-19 Update: Face Coverings, Advisory Groups on Restaurants, Barbershops, and Salons

section.p: (COLUMBUS, Ohio)—Ohio Governor Mike DeWine, Lt. Governor Jon Husted, and Dr. Amy Acton, MD, MPH, today provided the following updates on Ohio's response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

a.aria-label: Praise for Governor DeWine's Responsible RestartOhio Plan

a.h3: Praise for Governor DeWine's Responsible RestartOhio Plan

section.p: (COLUMBUS, Ohio) -- Business organizations across Ohio praised Governor DeWine's Responsible RestartOhio plan, which will restart Ohio's economy during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.

a.aria-label: Governor DeWine Announces Details of Ohio's Responsible RestartOhio Plan

a.h3: Governor DeWine Announces Details of Ohio's Responsible RestartOhio Plan

section.p: (COLUMBUS, Ohio)—Ohio Governor Mike DeWine, Lt. Governor Jon Husted, and Dr. Amy Acton, MD, MPH, today made several major announcements regarding Ohio's plan to responsibly restart Ohio's economy during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.

a.aria-label: COVID-19 Update: How Environmental Changes Impact Health Risk

a.h3: COVID-19 Update: How Environmental Changes Impact Health Risk

section.p: (COLUMBUS, Ohio)— During today's regular COVID-19 update, Ohio Governor Mike DeWine and Lt. Governor Jon Husted invited Mark Weir, Ph.D., an assistant professor of Environmental Health at The Ohio State University, to discuss how health risks change as changes are made to the environment.

div.a: Economic Resources for Individuals and Families
div.div: Ohioans are facing new financial challenges as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, and state agencies have a number of programs and policies in place to help them weather the storm.
Read the public health and executive orders signed by the governor and health director in response to COVID-19.

div.a: Guidance on Dispute Resolutions for Essential and Non-Essential Businesses
div.div: In accordance with the Amended Stay At Home Order that was issued that goes into effect on April 7, 2020 and runs through May 1 at 11:59 p.m, the following is guidance regarding dispute resolutions for essential and non-essential businesses.
